content: old baby with - optional crochet hook in the same size as needles 1 / 2 5cm of negative ease for the curly vine gauge - 19 sts and 30 row in 4 / 10cm in 4x1 rib blocked with any questions contact lifeiscozy@gmail com © 2022 all rights reserved www lifeiscozy com 1 contacts my name is ksenia naidyon i m the person behind life is cozy thank you for choosing this design use hashtags #cozypumpkinhat and #lifeiscozy to show your creations on instagram - websitelifeiscozy com - instagram@life_is_cozy - ravelrylifeiscozy - emaillifeiscozy@gmail com abbreviations bor beginning of round co cast on k knit k2tog knit 2sts together decreases 1 st k3tog knit 3sts together decreases 2sts p purl p2tog purl 2sts together decreases 1 st r round sl1wyib slip 1 stitch as if to purl with yarn at back of work construction notes - please knit a swatch the number of stitches per4 / 10cm is important to guarantee the circumference of the hat amount of ease and fit as well as the yardage the project would require - the hat is knit from the bottom up seamlessly in the round - the hem is worked in 4x1 rib then the hat is turned inside out and the work continues on the other side in 4x1 rib as well this makes the hem match the rest of the fabric the hem can be secured to the body of the hat so that it doesn t unfold - once the desired length is reached the crown is shaped with several rounds of decreases - the stem is attached to the crown seamlessly it is worked in the round using the magic loop technique or a set of dpns - the vine can be either crocheted with a crochet hook as on the sample hat or knit in an i-cord manner directions for both techniques are provided with any questions contact lifeiscozy@gmail com © 2022 all rights reserved www lifeiscozy com 2 pattern hem cast on 70 80 90 95 100 105 110 115 sts using long tail cast on join to work in the round being careful not to twist place a marker to mark bor r1 k4 p1 around repeat r1 for 7 7 9 9 11 11 13 13 more times for a total of 8 8 10 10 12 12 14 14 row of the hem if you wish to make the hem narrower or wider do this now body of the hat turn the hat inside out so that you are facing the wrong side of the work and needles are in the working position the yarn should be located to the left from the bor marker from here on this side becomes the right side and work resumes in the round again this makes the hem ribbing align with the rest of the fabric r1 sl1wyib k4 p1 k4 around r2 p1 k4 around repeat r2 for 6 6 8 8 10 10 12
